oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Steel engraving of President Andrew Johnson and Members of his Immediate Cabinet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Steel engraving consisting of images of President Andrew Johnson and members of his immediate Cabinet (Stanton, Seward, Chase, and Welles), with a heraldic eagle at the top and a depiction of the United States Capitol at the bottom.
Johnson served as Governor of Tennessee and in both houses of the Tennessee General Assembly and U. S. Congress. He became President upon the assassination of Lincoln and was impeached in 1868.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Stanton, Edwin McMasters, 1814-1869; Seward, William Henry, 1801-1872; Welles, Gideon, 1802-1878; Chase, Salmon P. (Salmon Portland), 1808-1873; Engraving; Cabinet officers
Capitols; Presidents; Cabinet officers; Steel engravings
